channel.title: Jung-gu on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Introducing the Three Musketeers of Namdaemun Market! Kalguksu, Sashimi, Tail Gomtang - Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
It's soft and crisp, not enough with one bowl of rice

Introducing the Three Musketeers of Namdaemun Market! Kalguksu, Sashimi, Tail Gomtang

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

It's fun to see the market even if there is no specific use. Fun to choose a variety of things, to taste a variety of food, and to see people. There is no end to the market views that have a lot of fun. Today, we are going to focus on ‘flavor’, which belongs to the ‘big fun’ of overflowing fun. As it is a representative market in Seoul, a variety of foods overflow. Introducing the more interesting Namdaemun & Dongdaemun taste tour than the market. Let's take a look at Namdaemun Market.

Before going on a full-fledged market taste tour, let's take a moment to look at the history of the market. Namdaemun and Dongdaemun markets, where at first glance the buried years are buried, when did they start? To know the history of the market, you must go back to the Joseon Dynasty. The market for buying and selling goods began to grow rapidly in the late Joseon period, when the exchange of goods from the barter to the full-fledged monetary economy began.

The more interesting the history of Namdaemun Market

Along with the history of the market, modern and contemporary history of the land comes together. In the market where people, money, and products are gathered, the situation at that time remains as clear as “Nite”. The capital, Hanyang, was the center of the market as well as the administration. The luxury goods and daily necessities needed by the palaces and the yangban corps flow to the present Dongdaemun, Lee Hyun (actor) and Chil plaque market outside Namdaemun.
The modern permanent market started in Seoul in the late 19th century, more than 100 years ago. At that time, the Ministry of Hanseong promoted a project to widen the road width by removing commercial temporary buildings lined up in Jongno and Namdaemun-ro. This temporary building was called a 'gaga (temporary building)'. The 'shop' comes from here. When the demolition of the small merchants' livelihoods are overwhelmed, the government gives them the warehouses of Namdaemun and Sunhyecheong. This is Namdaemun Market. But it didn't last long.
In 1905, the Japanese imperialists took the diplomatic right of the Korean Empire with the “Korea-Japan Negotiation Treaty”. With this treaty, Korea becomes a Japanese colony. At that time, the Japanese who lived on the yolks of Chungmuro and Myeongdong must have caught sight of Namdaemun Market. When rumors circulated that the Ministry of Justice would take the Namdaemun market and hand it over to the Japanese, Korean traders who were struggling to find an alternative to create a new market on top of it covering the section from Gwangcheon (now Cheonggyecheon) Gwanggyo to the officers. From Gwanggyo to officers, it was named “Gwangjang Market” after the preceding letter. This is the story of Gwangjang Market, which we are looking for to eat 'Nokdubindaetteok' and 'Drug Kimbab'.

Tour of Namdaemun Market starting at Exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station
Chilpe Market outside Namdaemun in the late Joseon Dynasty was famous for the Nanjeon. Although it is slightly different from the current position of Namdaemun Market, it is usually regarded as the beginning of Namdaemun Market. Namdaemun Market in the 21st century is also close to Myeong-dong, making it a popular tourist course.
When you come out of Exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station, the stalls on the side of the street greet us. From the udon and noodles, there are plenty of food stalls to enjoy, such as fried giblets and bear eel. What to eat starts with the most exciting worries in the world. The huge Namdaemun market travel guide is not overlooked. This time, let's focus on ‘Taste’ to suit the purpose of ‘Marketing Tour’. The main street starts from Exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station. Around this large street is the Kalguksu Alley, which is considered as a delicacy of Namdaemun Market, and the Galchijorim Alley. In addition to this, the gomtang restaurant <Eunho Restaurant>, which has been in business for over 30 years, and <chicken delicacy (formerly Gangwonjip)>, which has a delicious taste of torn chicken, are added.
When you come out of exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station
From cheap and hearty Kalguksu alleys to cooked tail soup
The starting point of the tour is Kalguksu Alley. The name is ‘Kalguksu Alley’, but when you order the type of rice (barley rice, rice), it comes with kalguksu and cold noodles. Even if you order Kalguksu, cold noodles are served. The cold noodles are served in a small bowl, but the noodles are quite generous. Two women can fill their stomachs with just one order of barley rice.
Namdaemun Market Kalguksu Alley View
It adds to the atmosphere of the market alley, so it's okay for a different emotional trip. Barley rice, cold noodles 5,500 won, kalguksu, sujebi, feast noodles 5000 won. However, what if you put your hands on your chest and you're pretty neat? Pass!
Namdaemun Market Kalguksu Alley
If you want to taste Kalguksu at a restaurant instead of a chair in a market alley, there is <Hansunjason Kalguksu>. Exit from Kalguksu alley and follow main road. Even if you order any menu, cold noodles are a service. Walk out to the main street again. Turn left at the intersection of Coco Shopping Center and Chengja Imports Shopping Mall and you will see Gomtang Restaurant <Eunho Restaurant> representing Namdaemun.
Namdaemun Market Kalguksu Kalguksu in the alley
Eunho Restaurant is a gomtang specialty store that has been passed down for three generations since 1932 for over 80 years, and has a history of Namdaemun Market. A bowl of Gomtang that has been carefully chopped has been loved by locals and marketers as well as local workers. You can taste tail bear soup (17,000 won), crucible soup (13,000 won), and Haejangguk (6000 won). In addition to <Eunho Restaurant>, be aware of <Jinju House>, known as the Namdaemun Market Gomtang House Yangdae Mountain Range. <Jinju House>, which boasts a relatively clear Gomtang soup, is located in an alley with brown rice.
Namdaemun Market's successor to the three generations <Eunho Restaurant>
Still, the menu that is indispensable in Namdaemun Market is braised!
Get out of <Eunho Restaurant> and go straight up to Main Street again. Anpan, Wangmandu, and fried fish cakes are eye-catching.
Deep-fried fish cake with popularity
Keep walking and a jokbaljip comes out. Then, if you see <Namdo Glasses>, turn left without hesitation. It is an alleyway. The whole winding alley is a galore house. Happy worry begins where to go.
Namdaemun Market Galchirim Alley
Serves one person without notice. If you order a braised stew (8000 won), you can even boil eggs (5000 won) and fried galchi (8000 won). When people who visit the first alley stewed sometimes order a stew or a tempura, the friendly owner adds, "Just stewed and give a fried egg and steamed egg."
If you order stewed brown rice, steamed egg and fried deep-fried chicken are a service.
Two bowls of rice are ready to serve in a sturdy yet crisp brown pot. If you decide to go on a diet, go after a success. A piece of brownfish steals the taste. Where is that? The chicken remodeling shop <chicken delicacy (formerly Gangwonjip)>, where you can choose the skin and flesh of your choice, is also a touch to protect the alley.
The pots filling the alley

Let's go on a trip to Namdaemun Market, a place full of food that tourists as well as tourists can enjoy without hesitation, and a trip to the beginning of winter.

▶ How to get to Namdaemun Market: Exit 5 of Hoehyeon Station on Subway Line 4
The pots filling the alley
Travel information

1.Nearby Restaurants

Eunho Restaurant: 50-43 Namchang-dong, Jung-gu, Seoul / Tail Gomtang, Haejangguk / 02-753-3263
Pearl House: 34-13 Namchang-dong, Jung-gu, Seoul / Tail Gomtang, Haejangguk / 02-753-9813
Jeonju Restaurant: 34-38 Namchang-dong, Jung-gu, Seoul / Garlic stew / 02-756-4126
Chicken delicacy (formerly Gangwonjip): 34-139 Namchang-dong, Jung-gu, Seoul / Open chicken / 02-753-9063

2.Accommodation

item.title: Rediscovering old buildings that shine as they get older, analog walks at Incheon Port - Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
Café spot, designated as a modern cultural heritage

Rediscovering old buildings that shine as they get older, analog walks at Incheon Port

Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea

Next to the bustling Chinatown, Incheon Open Port Modern History and Culture Town has a history of more than 130 years after opening. Compared to Chinatown, spaces that resemble black and white photographs seem to be hidden in the more leisurely streets. I found a space that has been reborn as a sensuous cafe or gallery by recycling buildings that have been lit up with traces of time. Let's walk through the faded time.
Reborn of a 100-year-old wooden house, cafe pot
When you go to the Incheon Jung-gu Office, the Japanese wooden houses create an exotic scenery. It is a painful trace of the looting after the opening of Incheon in 1883, but the scenery in which Chinatown and Japanese buildings are clearly divided is distinctive. In the streets of old churches, cafes, and museums, the buildings bearing the sign of 'Korea Modern Cultural Heritage' stand out. It is a cafe pot that has entered a 3-story wooden house for over 100 years. On weekends, it is always crowded with people looking for red bean porridge and red bean shaved ice.
Baek Young-im, who has been a citizen cultural movement in Incheon, opened a cafe here because of the value of architecture. This building was an office and a lodging company for over 100 Korean workers in Japan. After liberation, it was used for various purposes such as herbal medicine, Nonghyup, and newspapers. As it was revealed that the building was built between the late 1880s and the early 1890s, the white sand beach was examined with expert advice to see if it was worth preserving. As far as the record goes, there have been no cases where three-storey Japanese-style combined use houses remain intact. The interior structure was made as long as possible and hung on the restoration work for a long time.
Window seat facing the open port street
"I think it's better to keep what is left than to make it new. It was a pity that modern buildings in Incheon disappeared before they even announced their value. Even if it was restored, I hoped that it would be a cafe where people can come and go more easily than a space stuffed with history. I did it. "
In the following year, Fatal was designated as a registered cultural property No. 567 in recognition of its architectural value.
Myeongdang of Fatal connected to the outside garden
Inside the cafe, there is an old-fashioned atmosphere. Hand-held accessories, such as a wooden ceiling exposed in the old way, a small garden in the back yard, a table using a sewing machine used by my mother, and a phone made in 1918, matched nicely. Postcards and brochures are displayed at the entrance of the cafe where you can see the port opening season. On the 2nd to 3rd floor, there is a tatami room operated by reservation system.
2nd floor tatami room with black and white photos
Patal's representative menu is Nagasaki Castella, which is baked with plenty of red bean porridge made from domestic red beans, red bean ice water, and honey. There are many customers who visit the cafeteria near the school and remember the taste of red bean porridge that they bought and bought five times ago. Along with sweet red bean porridge, there are many customers who visit red bean shaved ice, which is sold only for 100 bowls a day on weekends, and castella, which was a gift for weddings in the 1960s and 1970s.
Sweet red bean porridge with chewy injeolmi and cinnamon scent
Ganghwa-do glutinous rice and glutinous rice cake made from domestic red beans are good to serve with black tea.
Glutinous rice cake made in a cooperative made up of local bakeries in Incheon
Gwandong Gallery, a house with a 90-year-old tree fragrance
From Fatal, enter Incheon Jung-gu Office and enter the alley on the left, leading to the Kwandong Gallery. After the opening, consulates and police stations were concentrated in this area. There were many government offices, so it was named Kanto. Named after the region, the Kwandong Gallery opens a unique exhibition by taking advantage of the regional characteristics of the cultural junction between Korea, China and Japan.
Current status of Kwandong Gallery

Traces of more than 90 years old are hidden in various places around the small exhibition hall. It is the couple of Ikuko Toda and photographer Eun-Gyu Ryu, who inadvertently breathe new life into an old house that might be overlooked, who went on a study abroad trip to Korea more than 30 years ago. In the Kanto region, which was a Japanese concession, there are Japanese town houses in the form of 'Machiya'. Kwandong Gallery is one of them. When viewed from outside the building, six two-storey buildings are placed side by side, and it is an unusual townhouse with a common courtyard behind the building.

"The house lives longer than people. From the 1920s to the 1930s, many people have gone through this house. Every time I tear off the ceiling and find a hidden space, I feel like breathing with a long time. It's a pleasure that you can't enjoy in an apartment. . "

Gwandong Gallery before construction
The attic provided on the second floor of the exhibition hall is a space where you can feel the excitement of reproduction. During the work of dismantling the ceiling, I found that the girder was connected from next door to next door. The secret space, which had been hiding for nearly 90 years, was renovated into a loft library where anyone can sit and read books after a minimal fee.
2nd floor exhibition hall and attic to guess the age of the building
Most of them are modern history books of Korea, China, and Japan, collections of photos, and books related to art. The more you look back and forth, the more attractive it is to see the invisible place and the charm of the wooden architecture and the sense of modern recycling of the old space. It is the result of revealing and utilizing the old and flawed parts rather than covering them.
2nd floor exhibition hall and attic to guess the age of the building
There is a bright space behind the prop shop on the first floor. This is a drawing room and guest room that has been converted from an old kitchen.
Reception room and guest room
Walls with peeling paint, old water pipes, and windows facing a 100-year-old stone wall seem to have a long story.
Reception room and guest room
The accessory shop on the first floor is full of vintage objects from various regions such as Japan, China, and Zimbabwe. Even the props, such as a 100-year-old travel bag and old wooden dolls, that the enema couples had directly obtained from Yanbian, resemble this space.
When entering the gallery, the first prop shop that greets you
Travel information

Fatal

-Opening hours: 11 am to 10 pm / Closed on Mondays
-Menu: sweet red bean porridge, red bean shaved ice, Nagasaki castella
-Inquiries: 032-777-8686

http://www.pot-r.com/

-Opening hours: 10 am to 6 pm / Closed Monday to Thursday
-Inquiries: 032-766-8660

http://www.gwandong.co.kr/

Restaurants near

-Shandong Kitchen: Tantan-myeon, Shandong Steamed Dumpling / 38 Chinatown-ro, Jung-gu / 032-765-6566
-Sipnihyang: Hwadeok Mandu / 50-2 Chinatown-ro, Jung-gu / 032-762-5888


Rooms

-Olympos Hotel: 257 Jemulyang-ro, Jung-gu / 032-762-5181

http://olymposhotel.co.kr/main.asp

-Harbor Park Hotel: 217 Jemulyang-ro, Jung-gu / 032-770-9500

http://www.harborparkhotel.com/

item.title: From colonial gateway to complex cultural space, Cultural Station Seoul 284 - Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea
item.description:
Seoul Station, transformed into Culture Station Seoul 284

From colonial gateway to complex cultural space, Cultural Station Seoul 284

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

Modeled after the Swiss Lucerne station, this magnificent brick building was once a colonial gateway. Japan tried to connect not only Manchuria but also Moscow and Berlin. The defeat made the Japanese ambition disappeared, but Seoul Station was still the center of transportation on the Korean Peninsula. As new history was built more than 10 years ago, the old Seoul history was reborn as a complex cultural space named “Culture Station Seoul 284”.

“Seoul Second Station”, the successor to Tokyo Station
Are there any Koreans who don't know Seoul Station? If you're an adult, you'll probably remember one of the memories of taking a train at the old Seoul Station in a red brick building. Now, the functions related to trains have been yielded to a new history and established as a complex cultural space, but the old Seoul Station, opened in 1925, has been the gateway to Seoul for nearly 80 years and is the representative railway station of Korea.
Old Seoul History
The designer of the old Seoul history, where the western arches with a magnificent dome are exotic, is known as Yasushi Sukamoto, a student of Tatsuno Kingo who designed Tokyo Station. At the time of construction, Seoul Station was an extra-large building with a total area of 6,631㎡ and was established as the "East 2nd Station," succeeding the "East 1st Station," Tokyo Station. After that, many parts were destroyed during the Korean War, but until the construction of the new Seoul Station in 2003, the old Seoul Station was the starting point and arrival point for numerous trains. Now, it is a complex cultural space called “Culture Station Seoul 284”, but it still remains as a memory of travel for many.
Seoul Station at the time of completion

However, Seoul Station was not simply built as a representative train station of Gyeongseong, the colony. In Japan, Seoul Station was planned as an 'international station' connecting Japan, Chosun and Manchuria. After the Japanese National Railways from Tokyo reached Shimonoseki, they changed to the Busan Line by connecting the deputy liaison line, and then boarded the train again to connect Seoul Station to Manchuria, Siberia, and even Moscow and Berlin. Accordingly, the entity that built Seoul Station was Nammanju Railway Co., Ltd. Called the abbreviation of “Mancheol,” the company was an imperialism for colonial management, just like the British East India Company. Like the UK, which railroaded across India to colonize colonies, Japan also adopted railroads as its central business for colonial management in Manchuria.

Culture Station Seoul 284 Sign
Imperial outpost connecting Japan, Manchuria, and Europe
This is because the Japanese imperialism built Seoul Station largely and splendidly because it was considered the outpost of the empire connecting Japan, Manchuria, and Europe.
Old Seoul History Central Hall
At first, it was attempted to build on a scale similar to that of Tokyo Station in Japan, but it was said that the damage caused by the Great Kanto Earthquake reduced the scale and the construction period increased. Nonetheless, Seoul Station boasted unparalleled feat as a gateway to the colony.
VIP room
On the first floor of the building, there were a central hall serving as a ticket office, a third-class waiting room mainly used by Koreans, a first- and second-class waiting room used by Japanese people, a waiting room for women, a VIP room, and a station room. The 3rd-class waiting room was used by both men and women, but the first and second-class passengers were able to distinguish between men and women, and women had to stay in the women's waiting room.
3rd Waiting Room
'Seoul Station Grill', the best western restaurant at the time, was located on the second floor. The place that appeared in the novel above was a collection of modern boys and modern girls.
Waiting Room
New Culture Station Seoul 284
It was in 2011 that the old Seoul Station was reborn as a complex cultural space called “Culture Station Seoul 284” after completing the original restoration project. “Culture Station Seoul” means a space where various cultural events are held centering on the exhibition, and 284 is derived from the historical number of Seoul Station. Most of the exhibitions are free, so any citizen can enjoy them.
Copper Plate for the 100th Anniversary of the Korean Railway
In front of the entrance with the sign “Culture Station Seoul 284”, there is a copper plate celebrating 100 years of Korean railroads. Railroad and train icons extending from north to south symbolize the role played by Seoul Station in the past. Across the street from Dongpan, you can see the old Daewoo Building, which appeared in the drama <Misaeng> and attracted attention.
The old Daewoo building that appeared in the drama <Misaeng>
When you open the massive front door, you will see a central hall composed of 12 pillars and domes. The stained glass on the ceiling is an image of Kang Gangsullae. In the spacious third-class waiting room on the right, installation art is being exhibited around a huge clockwork, and the Western-style fireplace and chandelier are still gorgeous in the VIP room used by the governor of Korea.
Stained glass on the ceiling of the main hall
The 2nd floor, where the Seoul Station Grill's large restaurant is located, is divided into several spaces to hold various exhibitions. The state-of-the-art exhibition seen in the 80-year-old modern cultural heritage gives a strange reverberation as if mixing time and space.
First and second-class waiting rooms
Because the bomb exploded at Seoul Station
Culture Station Seoul 284 leads to RTO. This place was originally a wooden circular staircase connecting the baggage stamp and the basement cargo hold. Baggage stamp refers to a place where passengers pick up their baggage from the departure station at the arrival station.
RTO performance hall entrance
After the liberation, however, the U.S. Army Transportation Corps used it and called it the RTO (Railroad Transportation Office), which is now used as a venue for inheriting its name. It is being used as a multi-purpose venue while demolishing the interior partitions and ceilings transformed by the U.S. military, exposing the walls and floors as it is to preserve the feeling of the ruins of the war.
RTO Performance Hall
In front of the RTO performance hall, there is a statue of a person wearing a hanbok scroll that does not match the high-tech complex cultural facilities. The left hand holds a fist with the size of a head, and the right hand has a grenade-shaped explosive. On September 2, 1919, during the Japanese colonial rule, he was an independent activist who threw a bomb at Seoul Station to kill the newly appointed Japanese governor, Saiko Makoto, in the wake of the 3.1 movement. It was still before the history of Seoul was built. Unfortunately, the bomb was missed, and doctor Kang Woo-gyu, who was caught during the escape, was executed at the Seodaemun Prison the following year. It should not be forgotten that the blood of independent activists is flowing in the background of the rebirth of Seoul Station 284 in Korea, which was built during the Japanese occupation.
Statue of Dr. Woo Kyu Kang
Travel information

Culture Station Seoul 284
Address: 1 Tongil-ro, Jung-gu, Seoul
Contact: 02-3407-3500

http://www.seoul284.org/


1.Nearby Restaurants

Dongdaemun Chicken: Chicken Gomtang / 12 Sejong-daero, Jung-gu / 02-722-1005

Libuk Son Mandu: Mandu / 17-13 Mugyo-ro, Jung-gu / 02-776-7350

Kraze Burger: Hamburger / B1, Seoul Square, 416, Hangang-daero, Jung-gu / 02-6456-8950

http://www.kraze.co.kr/

2.Accommodation

Just Stay: 3 Euljiro 40-gil, Jung-gu / 02-2271-2287

Hotel Daewooin: 22-2 Sejong-daero 14-gil, Jung-gu / 02-755-8067

http://www.daewoo-inn.com/

Toyoko Inn: 337 Toegye-ro, Jung-gu / 02-2267-1045

http://www.toyoko-inn.kr/

item.title: Daegu Metro Line 3, Sky Train Running Through the City - Jung-gu, Daegu, South Korea
item.description:
Daegu sky train running into the sunset

Daegu Metro Line 3, Sky Train Running Through the City

Jung-gu, Daegu, South Korea

Daegu Ground Railroad, which opened in April, is called a running observatory. A 10-metre high sky train runs over downtown Daegu and presents dynamic scenery. Passing between tall buildings, running across a wide river, flying over rooftops, you encounter Daegu with a different face. Sunsets and sunrises between buildings are also special. When you get off the sky train, you will see Daegu's attractions and food. Line 3 is the new starting point for the exciting Daegu trip.
Daegu's attraction in the sky
"Aze ~ This station is a achievement park." “Yeah, this station is Aigar Park Station where Saturn is located. If you are going to Dalseong Park or Daegu Native History Museum, you can get off at the right door. ”The Daegu Urban Railway Line 3, where the dialect announcement is heard, is catching the air. The first urban railway was opened in Daegu in 1997. Line 2 was completed in 2005, and line 3 began service on April 23, 10 years later. By May 31, there are 3 million visitors. An average of 76,500 people a day ride the train, which makes it more popular.
Run cool on the city without blockage
Daegu Metro Line 3 is a ground train called the Sky Rail, not a subway that runs through the basement. The sky train, with an average height of 11m, offers a panoramic view of the city.
Line 3 leaving Dalachi Park Station
When you cross the 200m wide Kumho River, you will feel like you are flying above the river. In Nam-gu, the mountains in front of the dense dwelling roofs face each other, and the Suseong Pond appears to the right as the Suseong Pond Station approaches. Behind the scenes, the sun breaks along the white waves and the train slides through the buildings. It is unexplored in Daegu.
Shincheon scenery from across Daebong Bridge
The view of Daegu through Line 3 after dark is also new. One or two lights are lit in each building, and the clothes are changed with colorful neon signs. Car lights passing under the trains flow like rivers, and the buildings standing on both sides along the Beomcheon stream catch the eye. It's also special to see the sun shining and reddening the building forest on the train.
The sunset seen from the train is more special
The sky train that runs from Daegu to north and south passes through 30 stations, ranging from Dongho-dong Chilgok Gyeongdae Hospital Station in Buk-gu to Beommul-dong Site in Suseong-gu. It takes 48 minutes to pass through the entire 24km section. It runs cool without waiting for a signal or being stuffy. It took 20 minutes or more to take more than 70 minutes when using a car. It runs from 5:30 am to 12:00 pm, every five minutes during morning and evening rush hours, and every other seven minutes. The rubber wheel of the vehicle is wrapped around the track beam to drive, so there is little noise and vibration, and the ride is comfortable, so you can feel comfortable in the scenery.
Passengers with a comfortable view of the city
Daegu Sky Train is Korea's first public transport monorail. In the world, there are not many examples of monorail in public transportation. It operates in 14 countries around the world, including Tokyo, Japan, Osaka, Chongqing, China and Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Among them, the Daegu sky train is the longest. We are proud of the best in technical part. As you pass through apartments and dense residential areas, a window-blocking device will protect your privacy. In the event of an emergency, Spiral Chute and a water spray-type automatic fire extinguishing system were installed to escape safely to the ground. It's an unattended operation, but worry can be put aside. One safety officer rides on each vehicle and monitors Chilgok vehicle base control system in real time through CCTV.
Korea's first public transport monorail
To transfer to another line, you can transfer to Line 1 at Myeongdeok Station and Line 2 at Sinnam Station.
Moving Observation Deck in Daegu City
Attractions in Daegu on Line 3
The station that people ride most is Seomun Market Station. The opening of Line 3 increased the number of visitors to the market by 40% on weekends. Exit the escalator at Exit 3 and you're at the market entrance. Previously, you had to walk 10 minutes from Sinnam Station on Line 2. Seomun Market, which was selected as the three largest market place in the Joseon Dynasty with Pyongyang and Ganggyeongjang, is the largest traditional market in Daegu. There are 4,700 stores in eight districts, including Dongsan Shopping Mall, except street vendors. There are so many things to see and do that you can't go around with half a day.
Attractions in Daegu on Line 3
In Seomun Market, you can't miss the food. In the Kalguksu Alley, where more than 50 noodle crises are gathered, people looking for hot kalguksu are hot even in hot weather.
Seomun Market Kalguksu Alley
Don't miss the barley rice. If you rub a lot of herbs in gochujang, you can literally taste honey. In addition, to eat flat dumplings, hotteok, tteokbokki, Sundae, etc., it takes several days to starve. The good news is that the night market will open in August. The night scenery of Seomun Market is already awaited.
Kalguksu and Barley Rice
After exploring the five senses at the Seomun Market, head toward the modern alley. Crossing Dalseong-ro from the market and walk about 400m to the side of Dongsan Hospital, Cheongna Hill is where the modern alley begins.
Flat dumplings belonging to 10 Daegu
If people are crowded at Seomun Market Station during the day, it is Suseongmot Station at night. Beomeocheon, which stretches straight up and down the Suseongmot Station, is a newly emerging photo zone. The dimly lit buildings and colorful buildings blend together to create a new look of Daegu night view. After watching the night view of Beomeocheon, you can walk about 5 minutes to Suseong Pond. Unlike the daytime scenery where you can enjoy the cool breeze of the lake and take a duck boat, the night view of Suseong Pond is gorgeous. A cool fountain show takes place to match the lighting and music. A variety of street performances take you around the promenade around the lake.
Night view of Suseong Pond with a music fountain show
When you get off at Dalseong Park Station, Dalseong Park is a place where you can meet old Saturn and mysterious animals, and you can walk to the Daegu Art Power Plant for free.
Dalung Park Gwanpungru
Get off at Daebong Station and walk for 10 minutes along Sincheon. In the alley full of murals reminiscent of singer Kim Gwang-seok, Kim Gwang-seok's song flows. The children's hall has the largest number of children. The lawn is a shelter for families, and an exhibition hall for various scientific experiences is a children's playground.
Citizens enjoying green walks along Saturn Park
Among the trains, the train with the theme of “Robocar Poly” is popular among children. Suseongmot Station, Dalseong Park Station, and Seomun Market Station give another fun to the broadcast by the friendly dialect.
Children cheering as Robocar Poli train comes in
Travel info

Daegu Metropolitan Rapid Transit Corporation / 250, Wolbae-ro, Dalseo-gu, Daegu, Korea / 053-643-2114

item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - “Where is the delicious vegetarian diet?” An omnivorous vegetarian restaurant experience
item.description:
Bad Farmers Cleanse Juice and Salad

“Where is the delicious vegetarian diet?” An omnivorous vegetarian restaurant experience

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

It is natural that modern people who have a great interest in health are worried about food. I know that 'what you eat' determines your body, but it's not as easy as you think to eat 'healthy food'. So prepared. Enjoy a Healing Vegetarian Trip in Seoul! Hongdae & Sinchon, a street where young people live in diverse cultures, Jongno & Insa-dong where temple restaurants are gathered, and Detox juice and salad specialty shops. Start with a vegetarian restaurant that is healthy and delicious!
Confess before starting the article. The reporter is an omnivorous man who is close to carnivorous, sharing a strong friendship with his flesh. Those who have been accustomed to the taste of chewing without caring about vegetarianism or sharing vegetarianism. This does not mean unusually looking for meat. Ordinarily, to put it plainly, I have eaten as soon as it is unbalanced. Paradoxically, this part is easier to understand by flipping the vegetarian tale of “There is no restaurant to eat.” That's because there aren't many restaurants in the land where vegetarians can eat comfortably.
Vegetarian, what is it?
Let's get to know here. For those who are indifferent to vegetarianism, 'vegetarians' are just people who eat grass without eating meat, but the type of 'vegetarian' is more subtle than you think. First, depending on whether you eat fish and seafood ‘Vegetarian’ 과 ‘Semi Vegetarian’ Divided into Vegetarian Is vegan Vegan Allowed only, milk and dairy products Lacto Allowed only eggs Ovo , Eggs, milk, dairy products Lacto Ovo Belongs. All of them do not eat meat, fish and seafood.
'Semi-vegetarian', which allows fish and seafood, eats milk, brown, fish and algae except red meat. Polo And milk, brown and fish Pesco And usually vegan, but depending on the circumstances Flexitarian Divided into Nowadays, more and more people are choosing 'vegetarian' as their practice for personal health and environmental protection.
Hongdae & Sinchon

There are some vegetarian restaurants in Hongdae, the “diversity special zone” as “the liberation zone of youth.” The atmosphere is different from that of Jongno & Insa-dong. Is it cafe which can serve meal? You can enjoy the brown rice health specialty restaurant Slobi, located near Exit 9 of Hongik Univ. I looked at <Jack's Bean>.

First, Sloby is the closest to Hongik University Station. At that time, the table is the most popular. We serve simple house rice with soup and some side dishes. It is popular as a dining place for those who aim for 'vegetarian' and 'healthy'.
Inside the sloppy
The Monday meal, which can be tasted only on Mondays, is only available as a vegetarian. At that time, he will show him a meal table (8000 won), assorted mushroom rice bowls (8000 won), fire (thong) meat bowl (8000 won), and then curry (8000 won).
Hongdae Café Slobby's most popular menu “Then That Time”
Vegetarians and non-vegetarians can "healthy eat" together.
Mushroom bowl of Slobby which is popular among modern people who want healthy food
Next is Sukara, located on the first floor of the Sanwoolim Small Theater in front of Hongdae. A new world unfolds with the menu board. In addition to the main dishes, desserts such as cakes, drinks and ice cream are also available for vegans. For those who don't eat milk, they also have soy milk drinks, a variety of fruit juices, tea, decaffeinated coffee, and organic wines.
Inside Sukhara, located on the 1st floor of Sanwoolim Small Theater
Of course, not only drinks, but also a la carte dishes such as meals and snacks are also available. Homemade natural yeast bread (5,000 won) for vegan, natural yeast bread and brown rice soup plate (12,000 won), Shinan village for fermented vegetarian cheeses (11,000 won), seasonal vegetable vegetables whole wheat pasta (12,000 won) and butter chicken curry (11,000 won) are also available. All menu items are available except cheese omelets, wholemeal pasta, and today's menus (12: 00-15: 00, 17: 30-20: 00).
Tofu Cheese Cake
Healthy desserts such as summer fruit cakes, amaretto ice cream (7500 won), tofu cheesecake (6,000 won), and homemade yogurt parfait (7500 won) are also available.
Homemade Yogurt Parfait
Not far from the Sanwoolim Theater, there is a falafel specialty store called Jaxbin.
Falafel Platter
In Korea, chickpeas, which are not grown, are called `` Falafel '' by grinding garlic, onions, and parsley into round pieces. When you cut the crispy outside, you will find a fresh skin that tastes like croquette. There is no meat, but it seems to eat meat.
Middle Eastern Sauce with Olive Oil, Garlic, Hummus
The flavor is revived by grinding chickpea with ‘pallafel’ and adding hummus, a sauce from the Middle East with olive oil and garlic.
Hollow Bread without Additives, Pita
When ordering a menu, say “Vegan” and cook it. Falafel wrap (6500 won), falafel sandwich (4800 won), falafel salad (6500 won), hummus (4500 won), falafel platter (15,800 won).
Bean dish with chickpeas and cheese
Ah, Slunch Factory near Sangsu Station and Loving Hut in Sinchon are also vegetarian restaurants near Hongdae.
Sandwiches made with palafel and salad in pita
Insadong & Jongno next to Jogyesa Temple… From temple food shops to simple vegetarian shops
There are a lot of specialty restaurants around Jongno & Insa-dong, where Jogyesa Temple is located. Temple food, commonly referred to as “zebap,” is literally their food. According to the Buddhist doctrine that prohibits 'killing', it has a natural vegetarian diet and tastes without coming (green onions, garlic, soothe, leek, red cherries). The taste of modern man, who is domesticated by various seasonings and seasonings, is boring to the mouth, but after eating, many people find it comfortable and healthy. Hongger is a plant that is not available in Korea and bans onions in Korea.
Wood bean soup at temple specialty shop <Bow Gongyang>
In the area around Jogyesa Temple, there are vegetarian restaurants such as <Gallery> and <Bow Gong Gong>, where temple food is served as a course. Of course, there are also (relatively) inexpensive menus that can be enjoyed on weekday lunchtimes.
Sacheol Rejuvenation Bath at the temple specialty shop <Bow Gongyang>
In Gosang, you can taste buckwheat miso rice bowl (15,000 won), balwoo (19000 won, perilla sesame tofu and mushroom gangjeong), and offerings (29,000 won, burdock vegetables, sodam soybean, mushroom hotpot). . In Bawong Gongyang, which offers course dishes, you can enjoy lunch specials such as lotus leaf rice set meal (12,000 won) from 1:00 on weekdays.
Mushroom Gangjeong showed that vegetarian food is also delicious
In Kwagane Food, located in Tongin Market, just a short distance from Insa-dong, there will be regular foods such as Ssambap (12,000 won) and Ginseng Pork Bulgogi (9500 won). In Five World Flavors, you can enjoy vegetarian noodles (5500 won), plum sweet and sour pork (15,000 won), and bean cutlet (11,000 won).
Meal of <Bowoo Gongyang> course, lotus leaf rice and modern miso soup
The victory of Jogyesa Temple is also known among Shinto people. You can enjoy feast, bibimb noodles, and seaweed soup (4000 won) at a reasonable price. In temples, noodles are called seung seung. This means that the noodles are delicious enough to make the monk laugh.
Lotus leaf rice with fragrant lotus leaf scent
Have you heard of? Juice Cleanse Cleanses My Body
Finally, we introduce 'Klen's Juice', which excludes even the chewing taste. It is a popular detox diet that cleans the body with detox juice, which removes toxic substances from the body. The practice is to replace meals with juices squeezed with only vegetables and vegetables instead of rice. Juices made up of only vegetable and fruit juices taste better than you think. Depending on their physical condition, detox juices can be taken from 1 day to 2 weeks in length. It's gaining celebrity thanks to the stars who have seen dramatic diet effects with the Juice Cleanse program.
A variety of juices from Detox juice shop Energy Kitchen
There are specialized Klens juice bars in Gangnam area such as Bad Farmers and Energy Kitchen on Sinsa-dong Garosu-gil. Juice prices vary slightly depending on the ingredients, but are higher than franchise coffee shops. The idea of juice instead of rice would be filled with the juice name 'Sorry, my body' and 'Well you're good to live' disappeared. I just laughed and was so sorry to end.
Bad Farmers Cleanse Juice and Health Bar
Travel info

1. Nearby restaurants

item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - Christmas & New Year Hotel Packages “For Special Holidays”
item.description:
Christmas package presented at InterContinental Seoul <Picture Credit: InterContinental Seoul>

Christmas & New Year Hotel Packages “For Special Holidays”

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

The cold winds make us lighter in our pockets. Here is a little extravagant hotel package for you who have been running hard for a year. Let's take a look just in case. Who knows and will meet someone who wants to make use of the Christmas hotel package!

Grand Ambassador Seoul

The All About Eve package is ready for romantic Christmas Eve. Christmas dinner at the banquet hall on the 19th floor with a panoramic night view of Namsan Mountain is included. Starting at 429000 won. There is also a “sweet holiday package” for romantic time only. It consists of one night, a bottle of wine and sweet macaroons in a cozy superior room for 24 and 31 days. Starting at 25,9600 won. There is also a “Namsan Sunrise Package” where you can prepare for the New Year while watching the sunrise at Namsan, the symbol of Seoul. Coffee and hot packs are useful for trekking in Namsan, and two room service breakfasts and a sauna pass for relaxing after sunrise. Only one day on December 31st. Starting at 28,3800 won. All guests have free access to the hotel's swimming pool and fitness. VAT 10% not included. Inquiries and reservations 02-2270-3111.

https://grand.ambatel.com/seoul/main.amb

Christmas Package 'All About Eve' <Photo courtesy of Grand Ambassador>
Grand Hilton Seoul

Grand Hilton Seoul has prepared three “Love At Christmas” packages only for a week from 19th to 25th for those who dream of a sweet and romantic Christmas. 'Love et Christmas 1' includes a Deluxe Room, Happy Hour Promo, where you can enjoy a bottle of red wine and unlimited draft beer from 6 pm to 9 pm. 'Love Et Christmas 2' will have dinner tickets added to the upgraded room. If you're dreaming of a day in a junior suite, you can use Love At Christmas 3. The price starts from 220,000 won. Contact 02-2287-8400.
http://www.grandhiltonseoul.com/

▶ Lotte Hotel Seoul

Lotte Hotel Sogong Branch will be hosting the 2014 Christmas Warmth Package from December 24 to 26. Superior rooms, breakfast buffet, Lotte Hotel bear doll, Christmas cake and wine, and mini Christmas tree. The Sweet Package, which includes upgraded rooms for juniors, will have room service for two Christmas special dinners. From 390,000 won.

Christmas Package <Photo courtesy of Lotte Hotel Seoul>

There is also a Happy New Year 2015 package on the last day of the year. There are `` Basic Packages '' which include superior rooms, breakfast, New Year's cakes, Zolme dolls to celebrate the Year, and `` Suit Packages '' to enjoy meals in upgraded rooms. From 320,000 won. Tax and service charge separately. Contact 02-759-7311
http://www.lottehotelseoul.com/kr/

Happy New Year 2015 Package (Photo courtesy of Lotte Hotel Seoul)
Mayfield Hotel

At Mayfield Hotel, the Christmas & Year-end package My Sweet Heart is available in three versions from December 24 to 31. It includes a "sweet box" containing imported sweets, jelly and candy, and a "sweet heart delivery" mailing of love letters.
"My Sweet Heart" version 1 features a Superior Room and a Michelin 2-Breakfast Buffet, while version 2 offers Christmas headbands and Santa Helena wine for Christmas Eve customers only. Version 3 has Christmas Eve performances and dinners. Starting at 276,000 won. Tax and service charge separately. Contact 02-2660-9000.

http://www.mayfield.co.kr/

Grand InterContinental Seoul

Grand InterContinental Seoul has a "Christmas of Love" package that adds cinema to your hotel break. Packages for the modern people who want to enjoy both relaxing and cultural life in the city include a chocolate basket and a bottle of wine. It also offers tickets to the Winter Festival Christmas Market booth held in the COEX complex. There is also a 'Celebrating 2015 Package' for the new year. In 2015, you can enjoy unlimited wine at the lobby lounge of the hotel, based on healing in the city, and experience Bongeunsa and other fireworks. Christmas packages start at 305,000 won and New Year packages start at 295,000 won. Tax and service charge separately. Contact 02-3430-8888
https://www.grandicparnas.com:444/kor/index.do

Celebrating 2015 Package (Photo courtesy of InterContinental)
Imperial Palace Seoul

Imperial Palace Seoul has prepared an “In the mood for love” package for a romantic Christmas in the heart of the city. Includes room, breakfast, real wood candle & saucer set. If you choose a room as a suite, room service such as wine, pizza, chocolate, and mini cakes is added. There is also an “In the Mood for Love-Special Eve” package where you can enjoy Christmas parties in your room. This is a special package that includes two tickets to the Lobby Lounge Del Mar's Christmas party in the “In the mood for love” package. There is also a New Year's Eve package that will allow you to enjoy the year-end party and the New Year. Christmas packages start at 290,000 won and New Year packages start at 220,000 won. Tax and service charge separately. Contact 02-3440-8000.
http://www.imperialpalace.co.kr/


※ The above information was created in December 2014. It may change afterwards, so please check before you travel.

2014 Christmas Package <Photo courtesy of Imperial Palace Seoul>

item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - Kung Fu Panda, how were you born?
item.description:
Kung Fu Panda Po in front of the Seoul Museum of Art

Kung Fu Panda, how were you born?

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

To the terrible kingdoms of Shrek and Fiona, to Qing Qingshan where the Kung Fu Panda Po was born, and to the Viking village of Burke where dragons fly. How were these places that seemed to exist somewhere in the world? If you're curious about the wonderful story and background that caught our eye, start here at DreamWorks Animation Special!
Dreamworks reveals the inner skin of animation
The characters in the movie move my way! DreamWorks Animation Special Exhibition, where Kung Fu Panda 'Sipu Sabu' makes you smile and you are waiting for a wonderful experience of Burk Island with Dragon 'Twosley'. This exhibition, which takes place from April 30 to August 15 at the Seoul Museum of Art, is an interesting event for anime enthusiasts.
The timid giraffe Melman of Madagascar
From the entrance of the museum, the big `` po '' greets you, and at the entrance of the exhibition, the dragon `` Twosleys '' greets you. This is where 20-year-old blood sweat animations are revealed.
Melman's cute face can be found inside the exhibition hall
You can see about 400 works of various types, from initial concept drawings to storyboards, original paintings, 3D characters and set models, movie scores, and masks.
Audiences Watching the Animation Exhibition
As you can see, it adds to the seasoning of each person in charge.
You can also see the initial animation in video
From sketch to screen

This exhibition is not just a place to introduce works. In order to look at the various collaborative work and the whole process to complete the animation one by one, it introduces it into three fields: character, story, and world.

Initial appearance and completion of current characters
There are various sketches on the wall of the character section that show how the initial idea was born as a character through concept drawing and sketching. Looking at the initial sketches, the character on the screen is unimaginably different and uncooked.
Visitors viewing various sketches
Familiar characters made of clay or plaster greet the audience in a transparent box.
Inside of special animation
Children also have no time to be bored. The Face Poser corner, where you can make facial expressions of famous characters, including Sifu Sabu from Kung Fu Panda, is perfect for children who are interested in art to raise their animators' dreams by changing their facial expressions.
Corner Face Poser to change the look of characters
What about the process of telling stories to these characters? The story section captures the eyes as if the artists were working and just moved away from the studio. Hundreds and thousands of storyboards, as well as video, convey the progress intact. In particular, the 'pitching' video, which conveys the story vividly like a grandmother who told a story in her childhood, is a must-see point!
Storyboards full of walls
The last section of the world is full of fun. There are numerous studies and worries to express the worldview of each piece in a realistic way. In particular, the best way to experience this exhibition is Bird's Eye View! Like the main character 'hiccup' in the taming of the dragon, it is mysterious as if flying on the back of the dragon 'Twosleys'.
Moved the animation studio table
DreamWorks' animation is not just for children. Dreams, hopes, and courage are the works that have been loved by the public by melting the values that humans should always pursue. Let's take a look at how these works are made and experience the true courage of children and the precious dreams that adults have forgotten. Your tomorrow will change anew.
The movie theater dragon flight which can experience bird eye view
Travel info

Dreamworks Animation Special Exhibition
-Address: 61 Seoul Deoksugung-gil, Jung-gu, Seoul
Inquiries: 02-325-1077

-Satisfied Five-Scented Foot: 134-7, Seosomun-ro, Jung-gu, Seoul / Satisfied Five-Scented Foot, Satisfaction Five-Scented Bossam / 02-753-4755

http://www.manjok.net/
-Jeonju Yu Grandmother Bibimbap: 27-2, Sejong-daero 14-gil, Jung-gu, Seoul / Jeonju Bibimbap / 02-752-9282

Rooms
-Motel B: 28-1, Saemunan-ro, Jung-gu, Seoul / 010-4451-6401

item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - K-Style Hub Meets Korea's Allure
item.description:
Korean Food Center

K-Style Hub Meets Korea's Allure

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

Modern man lives in a flood of information. Nevertheless, many people are thirsty for real information. Why? Isn't it because information comes to life only when it is connected to the person who needs it? Modern people living in a society where travel is routine and online 24 hours a day are no exception.
K-Style Hub, which opened on April 11, is a new style hub that can show Korean taste and fashion to both Koreans and foreigners. Experience of Korean food and Korean culture, as well as travel information on every corner of Korea, the best veteran travel experts in Korea provides one-on-one travel counseling services.
K-Style Hub, located in the office building of Seoul Tourism Organization, Jung-gu, Seoul, consists of 1,300 pyeong of space on four floors. On the second floor, you can get information on Hallyu and medical tourism, as well as travel information in every corner of Korea. Provide tourism information using Korea's advanced information and communication technology (ICT). If you miss the analog information, you can consult the information desk.
Tourist Information Center
If you are familiar with digital media, you can use digital kiosks, tablets, etc. to get the information, and you can also enjoy the information of the destinations taken by drones.
360 degree view screen
In addition, you can experience Korea's travel destinations right in front of you at the Oculus Experience Center using Virtual Reality (VR), as well as the lively photography corner with Hallyu stars such as Psy using Augmented Reality (AR).
VR experience
You can also enjoy skiing at the Pyeongchang Olympic Ski Jump, which will be held in Gangwon-do in 2018. If you can tolerate some dizziness, like a real ride.
K-Star Photo Zone
Take the escalator to the third floor. Korean Food Experience Center is located. It is also a space to learn about Korean food and food culture through Korean seasons and customs using Korean ICT technology. Along the entrance walls built with traditional Korean timber stacking methods, our seasonal foods printed on Korean traditional grate doors and windows are neat and stylish.
24 seasons and three customs
In the air at the far end of the 24 seasons passage, you can hear a drop of water dropping onto the pottery head and its waveform is projected on the wall. It is a moment when water, the source of life, which is so common and never felt its presence, feels mysteriously.
Head and Ingredients
You can then touch the various cereals, beans and spices in Korea and smell them with your nose. Behind the experience table, Jangdogdae brings back memories of Jangdogok that you played while playing hide-and-seek as a child. The voice yelling, "Hide it, I see your hair," wanders in my ears.
Traditional Changdokdae
On the other hand, three kimono cubes are placed in the middle of the exhibition hall.
Media show using Onggi lid
In the first cube, it is an experience space where you can open our seasonal ingredients one by one as you open the medicine cabinet drawer. The chest of drawers filled with harvested seasonal ingredients resembles our traditional barn. Next to it is a scarecrow hologram, standing alone in an empty rice paddy after an autumn harvest.
Cube that introduces the characteristics of Korean food
In the second cube, you can turn the handle by hand and read the book about Korean food, and the 9-sided Korean plate on our lacquer plate is round and round, and next to it is a modernization symbolizing harmony and balance of Korean food. There is a traditional Hansang experience corner. Again, turn the handle to line up the colors underneath the food, and the four foods are neatly laid out on a wide plate. It is a modernized Korean style dress considering balanced color and balanced nutrients and calories.
Cube that introduces the characteristics of Korean food
The final cube is a fixture symbolizing the value of convergence, one of the characteristics of Korean food. We show the charm of our bibimbap, that is, the beauty of fusion, which makes good use of the characteristics of unique ingredients while mixing and blending together to create a new taste through a work that sublimates various ingredients into artistic beauty.
Cube that introduces the characteristics of Korean food
Arirang resonates from the left side, and images form on 96 caps. Various patterns of Korean food and various foods that accompany them are projected, and the four seasons of Korea are depicted in ink paintings on the wall and over the fence. Korea's advanced ICT convergence technology utilizes our traditional Onggi to create beautiful works of art.
Cube that introduces the characteristics of Korean food
Let's go up one floor again. The courtyard surrounded by elegant hanok looks quiet. It is a Korean food experience center.
Korean Food Experience Center
Here you can taste the representative foods of Korea. You can buy food made from rice and beans, North Korean food, and various types of rice cakes and desserts in Korea.
Soybean Jeonbeak
At the Korean Food Center, 40 people can simultaneously experience Korean cuisine. In addition to our court food, Jongga food, temple food, Kimchi and Bulgogi, various cultural experiences can be arranged through reservation.
Traditional liquor
It is a space where master classes for famous chefs at home and abroad, as well as beginners, can easily make Korean food.
Chinese tourists taking cooking lessons at Korean Food Center
In addition to Korean cultural products, such as food and crafts, products from various fields created by small and medium-sized venture companies in Korea can be purchased at one place. In the middle of the store, works of hanbok that express the beauty of our hanbok are displayed, and next to it are various hanbok products that can be worn in real life.
Art market selling excellent cultural products
The newly opened K-Style Hub is creating a new paradigm of exhibition culture by combining the world's best ICT technology with our culture.
Venture Business Product Promotion Zone
In terms of design, it is a new landmark of Korean tourism that shows the excellence of our culture and art through beautiful harmony of black and white.
Sun + line + line by Han Young-hee, Hanbok writer
Travel info

K-Style Hub
http://korean.visitkorea.or.kr/kor/bz15/kstylehub/overview.jsp

-Address: 2F ~ 5F, Seoul Office Building, 40, Cheonggyecheon-ro, Jung-gu, Seoul
-Opening Hours: Tourist Information Center (Open all year round, 09: 00 ~ 20: 00), Korean Food Experience Center closed every Tuesday, 10: 00 ~ 18: 00
-Admission fee: Free (Korean food experience hall on the 4th floor sells food for a fee, and cooking class is operated by advance reservation.)
-Tel: Tourist Information Center (02-729-9497 ~ 9499), Korean Food Experience Center (02-6053-7177 ~ 79)

※ The above information was written in April 2016. It may change afterwards, so please check before you travel.
※ Information such as text, photos, and videos used in this article is copyrighted by Korea Tourism Organization, so unauthorized use of the article is prohibited.

item.title: Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea - National delicacies in Seoul!
item.description:
Just look at the mouthwatering visual Jeonju grandmother Bibimbap

National delicacies in Seoul!

Jung-gu, Seoul, Korea

Seoul is home to people from all over the country. Even if you miss the cozy hometown flavor or the exotic menus you've eaten at your destination, you can't leave because of your busy life. For those, I found restaurants that properly describe the local flavors in Seoul.
Jeonju Yu Grandmother Bibimbap
In Bukchang-dong Eatery Alley, which has been changing for a long time, it has been operating for over 50 years. Grandmother's own sesame oil is filled with a spoonful of jeongjeonyu grandmother Bibimbap.
Opened in 1962 by Grandmother Yu Ho Je, Jeonju, under the name of Jeonju House, the restaurant's main menu is Bibimbap and Bean Sprout Gukbap. But for decades, it's been so good that it's been a staple.
Now the daughter-in-law, who inherited the family, instead of her grandmother, carefully wraps a spoonful of sesame oil in a sizzling boiling stone pot. The amount of herbs is so much that you can't see the rice, and it's more special thanks to the egg yolk, which makes your hands thinner instead of ups and downs. All this goes well with gochujang made from ingredients that have been handed down from home! When rubbing, the key is to mix the texture with chopsticks instead of a spoon.
Jeonju Yu Grandmother Bibimbap with a taste that meets expectations
Another Jeonju local food, Kimchi Bean Sprout Soup, can't be eaten without taste.
Kimchi Bean Sprout Soup with spectacular boiling water
Crunchy bean sprouts, eggs, kimchi and rice combine to create a rich and harmonious taste. Unlike the clean Seoul style, it is seasoned with shrimp sauce to add a deep taste.
Ripe bean sprouts are so popular that it's easy to eat as a haejang
Enjoy fresh dumplings! Personality
There is a place in Seoul that makes the gyoza dumplings that are more unfortunate. Opened in 1967, it's a personality collection that maintains a consistent taste At this starting point is Kim Young-hee's grandmother. This house started with a round snack with wine snacks, and rumors started to grow with regulars. Although her grandmother, Kim Young-hee, died, her daughter-in-law, Moon Hyun-jin, keeps the taste as it is.
This dumpling is a real personality dumplings!
In general, the thinner the dumpling skin is, the more delicious it is. If the dumplings are thicker, they will taste less flour if cooked less thickly, and will be fuller if miscooked. However, this unique dumpling skin is surprisingly soft and moist. It's good to dip it in the intestine, but if you eat it with a spoon and sprinkle it on top of the dumplings, the liver will be soaked in moderately deeper taste.
Sprinkle with sauce to taste even deeper
Beef is fresh as well as meat, thanks to the generous amount of vegetables. The zucchini, which is characteristic of Kaesong dumplings, is full of chewy taste.
Kaesong dumplings filled with meat and vegetables
The highest peak of this house is by far the personalized Oisobak. Sheathed the cucumbers and put the ingredients simply soaked like Dongchimi. The combination of crispy texture and cool broth of cucumber ice cream is amazing.
Cool taste is a gem of personality pickled cucumber
Kaesong Sundae, which has been washed with inverted pig intestines several times and filled with plenty of vegetables, meat and vegetables, is also a sign of the house. As you chew, it pops in your mouth and scatters gently. The savory and chewy taste is more like homemade sausage than Sundae.
Various menus that make full use of individuality
In addition, various unique foods such as homemade chewy tteok-teokguk and Donggrang-tuk, reminiscent of meat jeon, have a unique taste.
Various menus that make full use of individuality
Goseong Makguksu (buckwheat noodles) with 100% taste of buckwheat
There is a place in the outskirts of Seoul, but it is not an exaggeration to say that no one knows if it is a makguksu enthusiast. Goseong Makguksu is a place that brings out the extremes of taste by adding Dongchimi to the simplicity of buckwheat noodles.
Buckwheat is more nutritious than other grains because it contains more protein. However, buckwheat is easily broken when heated. Made from 100% pure buckwheat, it is plucked out immediately upon receipt of the order to give its guests an elastic side. Noodles as thin as noodle are made with buckwheat's own coarse texture, yet convey the scent of buckwheat.
Goseong Makguksu comes with Dongchimi and Noodles separately
Dongchimi broth is also the heart of the house! It is made every morning and stored at room temperature for one day before it ages in the fridge. Cool Dongchimi soup is refreshing and sweet instead of seasoning intensity. If you pour Dongchimi soup with flesh ice, it is the best combination in itself. Bibim Makguksu is also a non-irritating seasoning so you can fully enjoy the taste and subtle aroma of buckwheat itself.
If you put Dongchimi with ice in a ladle, you'll be born a fantastic water buckwheat noodles!
Knitting is a taste that can not be missed. Gangwon-do Samhab is another specialty that is spicy and spicy and wears cold in the mouth, and adds white kimchi with crisp texture. Yeolmu Kimchi and Baek Kimchi are soaked once a week and matured in the basement.
Knitting to Fascinate the Mouth
If you're tired of traveling on weekends with warm spring scents, plan a city trip where you can casually taste and enjoy the local flavors. The taste of the filling of your mouth will give you another happiness.
The combination of knitting, white kimchi, and codfish is a delicacy.
